newsitem.title: USA: HORSE RACING-TOUCH GOLD UPSETS SILVER CHARM IN BELMONT.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-TOUCH GOLD UPSETS SILVER CHARM IN BELMONT.

text.p: Touch Gold charged down the centre of the track to snatch a Triple Crown sweep from Silver Charm with a victory in the 129th Belmont Stakes on Saturday.
Touch Gold caught Silver Charm in the final hundred yards of the 1 1/2-mile race to win by 3/4 of a length.
Free House, who dueled with Silver Charm through the stretch, tired in the final yards and finished another length back in third.
Having won the Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes, Silver Charm was the first horse to come into the Belmont with a shot at the Triple Crown since Sunday Silence in 1989.
The last horse to win the Triple Crown was Affirmed in 1978. Only 11 horses in history have claimed all three jewels of thoroughbred racing's classic trio.
"It's very hard to take," said Silver Star jockey Gary Stevens. "It was a gallant race, but we gave it our all."
Crypto Star, Irish Silence, Wild Rush and Mr. Energiser completed the order of finish in the longest of the three Triple Crown events run over a span of just five weeks.
Touch Gold, coupled in the wagering with Wild Rush, returned $7.30 $3.30 and $2.60 on a $2 bet. Silver Charm paid $3.00 and $2.40. Free House paid $2.70 to show.
